column1: For every minute you remain angry
column2: you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
and you will make the best speech you'll ever regret. - Ambrose Bierce

column1: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured. - Mark Twain
Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else. - Buddha

column2: count to ten before you speak. If very angry
column3: count to one hundred. - Thomas Jefferson

column1: Anger is never without a reason
column2: but seldom with a good one. - Benjamin Franklin

column1: You will not be punished for your anger
column2: you will be punished by your anger. - Buddha

column1: Anger is a valid emotion. It's only bad when it takes control. - Anonymous

column3: but to be angry with the right person is not easy. - Aristotle
